intro: Bignonia ferdinandi, commonly known as the yellow bells, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a deciduous vine characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant belongs to the Bignoniaceae family, which includes other ornamental vines and trees. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Its rapid growth habit makes it suitable for trellises or as a ground cover in gardens.
